channel.title: CVE Feed for WWBN -- AVideo
channel.description: The latest CVEs for WWBN -- AVideo

item.title: CVE-2022-32771|2024-09-17T02:37:26.838Z -- wwbn -- avideo
item.description: A cross-site scripting (xss) vulnerability exists in the footer alerts functionality of WWBN AVideo 11.6 and dev master commit 3f7c0364. A specially-crafted HTTP request can lead to arbitrary Javascript execution. An attacker can get an authenticated user to send a crafted HTTP request to trigger this vulnerability.This vulnerability arrises from the "success" parameter which is inserted into the document with insufficient sanitization.

item.title: CVE-2022-30605|2024-09-17T02:47:58.703Z -- wwbn -- avideo
item.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability exists in the session id functionality of WWBN AVideo 11.6 and dev master commit 3f7c0364. A specially-crafted HTTP request can lead to increased privileges. An attacker can get an authenticated user to send a crafted HTTP request to trigger this vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2022-26842|2024-09-17T02:00:46.494Z -- wwbn -- avideo
item.description: A reflected cross-site scripting (xss) vulnerability exists in the charts tab selection functionality of WWBN AVideo 11.6 and dev master commit 3f7c0364. A specially-crafted HTTP request can lead to arbitrary Javascript execution. An attacker can get an authenticated user to send a crafted HTTP request to trigger this vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2022-32772|2024-09-17T00:42:33.856Z -- wwbn -- avideo
item.description: A cross-site scripting (xss) vulnerability exists in the footer alerts functionality of WWBN AVideo 11.6 and dev master commit 3f7c0364. A specially-crafted HTTP request can lead to arbitrary Javascript execution. An attacker can get an authenticated user to send a crafted HTTP request to trigger this vulnerability.This vulnerability arrises from the "msg" parameter which is inserted into the document with insufficient sanitization.

item.title: CVE-2022-28710|2024-09-17T01:01:19.447Z -- wwbn -- avideo
item.description: An information disclosure vulnerability exists in the chunkFile functionality of WWBN AVideo 11.6 and dev master commit 3f7c0364. A specially-crafted HTTP request can lead to arbitrary file read. An attacker can send an HTTP request to trigger this vulnerability.
